raw_data.official_title: Phase IV Study of Determining the Efficacy of Ampicillin/Sulbactam Combination as Antibiotic Prophylaxis During Breast Cancer Surgery in Patients With a Body Mass Index (BMI) Over 25.

criteria.raw_text:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Women at any age with early stage breast cancer (stage I-II) and American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) score of I-II.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS; stage 0 cancer),
* Advanced or distant metastatic stage,
* Receiving any neoadjuvant therapy,
* History of receiving any antibiotics within prior 3 months,
* History of immunodeficiency,
* Having a remote infection,
* History of reaction to study antibiotics,
* Denial of signing the consent form.

structurized.raw_text: Women at any age with early stage breast cancer (stage I-II) and American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) score of I-II.
structurized.category: compound_Criterion- when there are two or more criterions which can be seperated into various questions
structurized.category_reasoning: The criterion includes two separate conditions that must be met: having early stage breast cancer (stage I-II) and having an ASA score of I-II. These are distinct criteria that are combined using the logical operator 'AND'.
structurized.overall_thoughts: This criterion is clearly defined and specifies two distinct conditions that must be met for inclusion in the trial. It is a compound criterion because it involves more than one condition that can be separated into individual questions.

criterions.raw_text: Women at any age with early stage breast cancer (stage I-II)
criterions.category: atomic_Criterion- where there is only one criterion that can be answered with a simple question
criterions.category_reasoning: The criterion specifies a single condition that can be answered with a yes or no: whether a woman of any age has early stage breast cancer (stage I-II).
criterions.overall_thoughts: This criterion is straightforward, specifying the demographic (women) and the condition (early stage breast cancer, stage I-II) without any additional sub-criteria.
qualifiers: with early stage breast cancer (stage I-II)

criterions.raw_text: American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) score of I-II
criterions.category: atomic_Criterion- where there is only one criterion that can be answered with a simple question
criterions.category_reasoning: The criterion specifies a single condition related to the ASA score, which is a standard classification system for assessing the fitness of patients prior to surgery. It is a straightforward criterion that can be answered with a simple yes or no question regarding the patient's ASA score.
criterions.overall_thoughts: This criterion is clear and specific, focusing on the ASA score, which is a common measure used to assess a patient's preoperative health status. It is a standard criterion in clinical trials involving surgical procedures.
additional_information: The ASA score is a system for assessing the physical status of patients before surgery. It ranges from I (a healthy patient) to V (a moribund patient who is not expected to survive without the operation).
